channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Nepal Festival Brisbane 2025
item.description:
Sunday, 6 April 2025

City Hall will be lit Blue, White and Maroon to support Nepal Festival Brisbane 2025

The Nepal Festival Brisbane 2025 is showcasing Nepal’s culture and rich traditions, music, dance, food, and heritage to a diverse audience, in King George Square, Saturday April 6 2025, from 10am. Mark your calendars for this unmissable celebration of Nepalese culture in the heart of Brisbane City.

This Light Up is organised by: the Non-Resident Nepali Association

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Limb Loss & Limb Difference Awareness
item.description:
Monday, 7 April 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Orange to support Limb Loss & Limb Difference Awareness

Aussie Hands provides support, information and encouragement to people born with a hand difference and their families. April is Limb Loss & Limb Difference awareness month, an initiative by the Amputee Coalition aimed at shining a light on the experiences of individuals living with limb differences of limb loss.

This Light Up is organised by: The Aussie Hands Foundation Incorporated

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Australian Swimming Age Championships
item.description:
Thursday, 10 April 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Green and Gold to support Australian Swimming Age Championships

See the future of Aussie swimming at the 2025 Age Swimming Championships as the largest annual event on the Swimming Australia calendar comes to the Brisbane Aquatic Centre from 10th-18th April. Visit the Swimming Australia website for more information

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: #SparktheNight - World Parkinson's Day
item.description:
Friday, 11 April 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Mid Blue to support #SparktheNight - World Parkinson's Day

On behalf of Parkinson’s Australia, PD Avengers and the Global Alliance to End Parkinson’s Disease Association, landmarks are being illuminated for the 11.8 million individuals living with Parkinson’s disease worldwide. These organisations believe that by lighting up these assets, it shows a powerful symbol of solidarity and advocacy for the 150,000 Aussies living with Parkinson’ s in Australia. This global initiative is in recognition of World Parkinson’s Day on April 11, 2025 #SparktheNight

This Light Up is organised by: Parkinson's Australia

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Pakistan Day Celebrations - Community Event
item.description:
Saturday, 12 April 2025

City Hall will be lit Green White to support Pakistan Day Celebrations - Community Event

The Pakistan Day event hosted by the Pakistan Australian Cultural Association Inc celebrates and showcases the rich heritage and culture of Pakistan with thousands of locals on Saturday, 12th April 2025 from 4pm. The event uplifts the recognition and community efforts of the Pakistani Australian community in beautiful multicultural Queensland. Everyone is welcome to join the Mega Pakistan Day event at King George Square.

This Light Up is organised by: Pakistan Australian Cultural Association

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Tour de Brisbane
item.description:
Saturday, 12 April 2025

Story Bridge will be lit White and Pink to support Tour de Brisbane

The Tour de Brisbane is a mass participation bike ride in Brisbane City on Sunday 134 April 2024. Whether you’re going for a pedal with the family, or going for the podium, there’s something for everyone at Australia’s ultimate Sunday ride! With multiple rides to choose from, over 120km* of roads closed to all traffic, there’s no better way to experience the landmarks of Brisbane and raise funds for The Common Good, an initiative of The Prince Charles Hospital Foundation.

This Light Up is organised by: NX Sports Community Foundation Limited

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World Voice Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 16 April 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Red to support World Voice Day

World Voice Day is traditionally celebrated on 16 April and was founded in Brazil back in 1999 with the aim of drawing attention to the science and phenomenon of voice production. It soon grew to highlight the significant role that the voice plays in every aspect of our daily lives. World Voice Day has gained momentum across the globe, and currently over 50 countries join the annual celebration during the month of April.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Dysphonia Network Inc

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.xCal:description:
Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red to support World Voice Day
World Voice Day is traditionally celebrated on 16 April and was founded in Brazil back in 1999 with the aim of drawing attention to the science and phenomenon of voice production. It soon grew to highlight the significant role that the voice plays in every aspect of our daily lives. World Voice Day has gained momentum across the globe, and currently over 50 countries join the annual celebration during the month of April.
This Light Up is organised by: Australian Dysphonia Network Inc

item.title: World Haemophilia Day
item.description:
Thursday, 17 April 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Red to support World Haemophilia Day

World Haemophilia Day is the 17th of April and raises awareness about bleeding disorders and the need to build a family of support for those living with this disorder. Families come in many forms but they all share the ability to support and advocate.
The Haemophilia Foundation Queensland (HFQ) provides representation, health promotion, education and support for people in Queensland affected by inherited bleeding disorders.

This Light Up is organised by: Haemophilia Foundation Queensland Inc.

item.title: Anzac Day
item.description:
Friday, 25 April 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red to commemorate Anzac Day

As the sun rose on 25 April 1915, Australian and New Zealand soldiers rowed towards the shores of Gallipoli and into history. Every year since, Australians have gathered at Dawn Services or services of Remembrance, at parades, or in their driveways each year to remember their legacy and that of all who have followed in their footsteps.
The first ANZAC Day Parade took place in Brisbane on the 25 April 1916. While we remember those who paid the ultimate sacrifice for freedom during the Dawn Services and other services of Remembrance, the ANZAC Day Parade is an opportunity to celebrate and recognise all those that have served and still continue to serve our country.
The parade will be held on Adelaide Street, between George Street and Creek Street. From the Governor of Queensland’s address at King George Square at 9:45am to the last marching participants at 12:25pm, it will feature former and current ADF veterans and other support organisations that contribute to the Parade that make it the commemoration worthy of its heritage.

This Light Up is organised by: Returned Services League of Australia (Qld Branch) South Eastern District Limited

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Brisbane Comedy Festival
item.description:
Saturday, 26 April 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue, Yellow, Red and Pink to celebrate Brisbane Comedy Festival

Lovers of LOLs, prepare for a macro dose of the good medicine, as Brisbane Comedy Festival returns for its sweet 16th edition at venues across the city from 23 April to 25 May 2025.
Queensland’s largest and most anticipated comedy event will see a power squad of Australian and international comedians deal out a whole month of belly laughs at Brisbane Powerhouse, The Tivoli, Fortitude Music Hall and The Princess Theatre. In a multi-venue laughter extravaganza that will play host to one-liners, whimsy and tall tales from some of the most hilarious comedians around.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Powerhouse

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

Lovers of LOLs, prepare for a macro dose of the good medicine, as Brisbane Comedy Festival returns for its sweet 16th edition at venues across the city from 23 April to 25 May 2025. Queensland’s largest and most anticipated comedy event will see a power squad of Australian and international comedians deal out a whole month of belly laughs at Brisbane Powerhouse, The Tivoli, Fortitude Music Hall and The Princess Theatre. In a multi-venue laughter extravaganza that will play host to one-liners, whimsy and tall tales from some of the most hilarious comedians around.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Powerhouse

item.title: Australian Tourism Exchange
item.description:
Sunday, 27 April 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Green and Gold to support Australian Tourism Exchange

The Australian Tourism Exchange, is the Australian tourism industry’s largest annual business-to-business event with the 2025 being the 45th edition. Taking place at the Brisbane Convention and Exhibition Centre between Sunday 27 April and Thursday 1 May 2025 in partnership with Tourism and Events Queensland and Brisbane Economic Development Agency, the event will bring together Australian tourism businesses with global distribution partners from over 60 nations conducting scheduled business appointments and participate in key networking events. This event will highlight the best of Queensland with Brisbane as the centrepiece.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Eve of International Dance Day
item.description:
Monday, 28 April 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Orange to support Eve of International Dance Day

International Dance Day, and Australian Dance Day is on April 29th 2025, starting Australian Dance Week from 29th April - 4th May 2025. Across the world, messages, performances and celebrations are held to recognise the significance of dance in community and culture. In Brisbane, Ausdance QLD has over 400 studio and organisation members working with approximately 20,000 students and participants, as well as teachers, dancers and dance health professionals. In community, health and schools, an estimated 100,000 people in Brisbane participate in dance activities from social recreational, dance for health, to latin, to First Nations Cultural and everything in-between. As the peak body for dance in Queensland, Ausdance QLD aims to promote and support people, organisations, companies and communities practicing and performing all forms of dance - across traditions, cultures, styles and genres with professional development, helplines, business support and resources, as well as advocacy with the national Ausdance network

This Light Up is organised by: Ausdance Queensland

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World Make a Wish Day - 'Wear It Blue To Make Wishes Come True'
item.description:
Tuesday, 29 April 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support World Make a Wish Day - 'Wear It Blue To Make Wishes Come True'

On April 29th Make-A-Wish Australia will be celebrating World Wish Day, a day that marks the first ever wish granted by Make-A-Wish US in 1980. Make-A-Wish Australia has been creating life-changing wishes for children with a critical illness since 1985 and celebrates the day with 'Wear It Blue To Make Wishes Come True' - where we encourage all Australians to wear blue to show their support for wishes and all of the inspirational people who help make them come true.
Over these 40 years Make-A-Wish Australia has granted over 11,000 unique, inspiring and extraordinary wishes across the country, and for everyone involved, these wishes have a remarkable, uplifting and positive impact - well beyond the wish itself.


This Light Up is organised by: Make a Wish Foundation

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
